name: 8 Dyer Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at 8 Dyer for 4 days at the end of August. We had knowingly booked the smallest (and cheapest) room, and it was very compact, but well designed. More importantly, everything about the room and the Inn was stylish and of good quality - beautiful bedding, towels, glossy magazines, and lovely touches like chilled water always available, cookies, and lemonade by the pool. Breakfast was generous and varied - bagels, croissants, delicious scones, smoked salmon, ham, cheese etc. Best of all was the amazing kindness and hospitality of the owners Frank and Tim. Not only did they insist on picking us up and returning us to the ferry in their car, but when the Inn's (free) bikes were too big for me, Frank drove me to the bike rental shop and insisted on paying for my hire of a girl's bike. He also gave helpful restaurant recommendations and made bookings for us. We had an amazing time, and loved Provincetown. We were concerned that as a straight couple, it might be too camp for us, but it's a really beautiful, classy town, with lots of good restaurants and galleries, and the fun of camp nights out if you want them. We would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Unbelievable kindness and hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 8 Dyer Street is very nice, and I whole-heartedly recommend choosing to stay at this location.
reviews.title: Loved 8 Dyer, loved Provincetown, so will you :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The two partners who run the place are good hosts; conversation flows easily, and Frank goes over-the-top to ensure you get the breakfast you want. They're also good for recommendations on places to eat in the area and can take into account your budget, which is nice, since it's pretty expensive eats around town.
reviews.title: Simply phenomenal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in one of the penthouse rooms. The pictures on the hotel website are accurate, although they make the room look a bit larger than it is. It's "I had a bigger studio in college than this" small. If you're claustrophobic, it's not the place for you. If you like looking on the bright side, it's cozy :). Don't let the size turn you off; most places in the area are small, and I'd wager few are as nice.
reviews.title: Phenomenal Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The loft area is a large, jacuzzi style bathtub that seats one. Two windows open up above and provide a lovely cross-wind and mood lighting. Everything is nicely put together, really (wood accents and such), and the soaps provided are CO Bigelow; the trendy stuff you expect at this price point. Towels are soft. Bathrobes are provided. The downstairs bathroom is small, but nicely appointed. There's a hairdryer, too, which is a plus.
reviews.title: Defining hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our husbands rode in the Pan Mass Challenge this past week end. My friend and I arrived before the check in time with the bikes and Tim and Frank took them and stored them for us. They took care of our car, too, so we could meander around and wait for the guys. Our room was spotless, the bed was very comfortable and we had a jacuzzi tub in a loft above our room, perfect for sore muscles! We enjoyed chatting with other guests around the pool and in the lobby area.The breakfast was wonderful. Frank made recommendations and reservations for us at two fabulous restaurants. The atmosphere is casual, comfortable and cozy and Frank took very good care of us during our stay. We'd come back to 8 Dyer any time!
reviews.title: We can't wait to come back to 8 Dyer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this for a one night stay in Provincetown. The hotel itself is beautiful - extremely well maintained, clean and modern rooms, tasteful decor, lovely outdoor pool - but what made this a 5+ star visit was the personal, thoughtful and charming service. From our pickup at the ferry docks, to spot-on tips on where to drink and dine, to the incredible (and unexpected) breakfast spread, we couldn't have asked for anything more. Then to top it all off, when faced with a long walk with our luggage through town at the end of our stay, Frank saved us the slog by delivering them for us after we had enjoyed a great lunch on a patio. We would highly recommend 8 Dyer to anyone.
reviews.title: Great service made the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is really cozy , Frank the owner its a really nice person and his allways looking a way for helping you in anything you need .
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice and very very clean , location its really good cause you are near everything but not in the middle of everything .
reviews.title: We are lucky we got the chance to stay here- Will definitely come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went this past weekend to 8 Dyer Hotel to celebrate my anniversary with my boyfriend. After what was a horrible start to the weekend (car problems, traffic, etc.) we were so pleasantly surprised by 8 Dyer. The hosts are so welcoming and kind (including their adorable dog, Emma). Our room was gorgeous and so comfortable and clean. We only wished we had longer to stay so we could have enjoyed the awesome pool and jacuzzi. The Inn is situated within steps to all activities, including Commercial St where we spent most of our time. So many great places to eat, shop and have fun. We are already beginning to plan our return trip for the winter.
reviews.title: Friendly and Warm Hotel with perks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not think in staying elsewhere in Provincetown. It would be a terrible mistake. 8 Dyer has everything you will need: Extraordinarily well appointed rooms (small shower though at least in our room), confortable beds, a nice swimming pool and jacuzzi, a very good breakfast, full of great choices, some of them homemade, free bycicles ...
reviews.title: THE OPTION in PTown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: But the soul of the hotel are it owners, Tim and, specially, Frank. They have a deep knowledge of what a guest can need when in PTown, and they help with everything, from directions, to reservations or shopping tips.
reviews.title: Brilliant surroundings,unmatched service ,within walking distance of paam center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Frank was always - discretely - there and his conversation is delightful. He made our stay perfect and we felt in love with Ptown and 8 Dyer hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing hospitality, convenient location, great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Not a care in the world. I felt pampered and well taken care of . This b and b in the east side is within walking distance of most major attractions. They even provide 4 bikes for the use of their guests. First come first serve. Breakfast in the morning includes an assortment if fresh fruit, fine cheese, meats, baked goods,homemade granola,fresh brewed coffee etc. Oh and great conversation. An international clientele it is food for the soul. Frank had the best restaurant recommendations. His knowledge of the area is encyclopedic. Hoping to return as soon as possible.
reviews.title: Outstanding service in a contemporary setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Tim and Frank were incredible hosts. We used 8 Dyer's free bikes to ride to Race Point and enjoyed a lovely day on the beach. Breakfast was served each morning with homemade muffins,cinnamon buns, lox and bagels, fresh fruit, homemade granola and espresso. 8 Dyer is a very short walk to all the hot spots but tucked away so it is very quiet and relaxing. Would strongly recommend this to anyone visiting Provincetown.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely guest house and the hospitality of Tim and Frank, as others on here have commented, is excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent place in P'town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed in a few nice B&Bs over the years but often find the owners can be a bit fussy. Not at all here--if you're getting a late start and want to have breakfast later than the 'cut off,' it's no big deal. Going to the beach? Take the bikes! Catching a flight at the airport? Frank will give you a lift. All in all it's a very comfortable, welcoming place.
reviews.title: THE BEST EVER !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was extremely comfortable, pool is a nice (and unique in P'Town) touch, sauna and jacuzzi can keep you warm on a cool day, and the Malin + Goetz products in the bathrooms distinguish them as a true high end offering (no "conditioning shampoo" bolted into the wall like some places!)
reviews.title: To Dye for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 10, which had a *lovely* balcony overlooking the pool. Great place to hang out in sun loungers and because of the angle it's definitely the best place to get the afternoon sun.
reviews.title: Best Place To Stay...hands down!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The *only* critical thing I can write is that the layout of the property, with all rooms off a central open duplex type area, means that if one of your fellow guests is a noisy lady from New York who seemingly can only communicate with her husband by yelling over breakfast, you won't be able to sleep in.
reviews.title: The gold standard in hospitality!

description: 8 Dyer is a traveler’s ideal: a haven of serenity for body and mind, only steps from the city’s best shopping, bustling sights and lively night life. A sophisticated boutique hotel, we offer refined and mindful personalized service. Conveniently situated near Provincetown’s renowned gallery district just off historic Commercial Street, 8 Dyer is a new, chic fixture on the Provincetown scene. 8 Dyer offers genuine and unrivaled comfort without fuss or pretense. Fall in love with our glass-walled great room; guests can soak up the sun and relax in comfort, listen to music, or get lost in a new book. It’s a great place to socialize and meet others, or just sit by the fire and keep warm on our crisp fall days. Indulge in our expanded complimentary breakfast by the heated swimming pool in the morning, then revive in our large Jacuzzi spa and Finnish sauna before you go out at night. Our accommodations are as modern as they are versatile. All rooms and suites are outfitted with King or Queen beds, luxurious bedding and linens, plush towels, our signature bath amenities, and complimentary internet access. Most of our rooms also have fireplaces, for those romantic afternoons. 8 Dyer: a hotel where you can be comfortable and relaxed.
